de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep
Class AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.AbstractProofRuleSet
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProofRuleSet, Iterable<ProofRule>
Direct Known Subclasses:
L0BigStepProofRuleSet
public abstract class AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet
extends AbstractProofRuleSet

Abstract base class for big step proof rule sets, that are used for the BigStepProofModels.

Version:
$Rev: 377 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
AbstractProofRuleSet, BigStepProofModel

Constructor Detail

AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet

protected AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet(Language language)
Allocates a new AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet for the specified language.

Parameters:
language - the Language to which the big step proof rules in this set belong.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if language is null.
Method Detail

register

protected void register(int group,
                        String name,
                        Method applyMethod)
Convenience wrapper for the register(int, String, Method, Method) method, which simply passes null for the updateMethod parameter. The rule is prepended to the list, which is important for guessing, as the last registered proof rule will be used first when guessing. So, for example, for the big step interpreter, the (APP) must be registered first.

Parameters:
group - the group id of the big step rule, see the description of the AbstractProofRule.getGroup() method for details.
name - the name of the big step proof rule to create.
applyMethod - the implementation of the apply method for the big step interpreter.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if name or applyMethod is null.
See Also:
register(int, String, Method, Method)

register

protected void register(int group,
                        String name,
                        Method applyMethod,
                        Method updateMethod)
Registers the rule with the given name and the applyMethod and updateMethod. The updateMethod may be null. The rule is prepended to the list, which is important for guessing, as the last registered proof rule will be used first when guessing. So, for example, for the big step interpreter, the (APP) must be registered first.

Parameters:
group - the group id of the big step rule, see the description of the AbstractProofRule.getGroup() method for details.
name - the name of the rule.
applyMethod - the apply() method.
updateMethod - the update() method or null.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if name or applyMethod is null.
See Also:
register(int, String, Method), AbstractProofRuleSet.register(AbstractProofRule)

registerByMethodName

protected void registerByMethodName(int group,
                                    String name,
                                    String applyMethodName)
Convenience wrapper for the register(int, String, Method) method, which determines the Method for the specified applyMethodName and uses it for the applyMethod. The rule is prepended to the list, which is important for guessing, as the last registered proof rule will be used first when guessing. So, for example, for the big step interpreter, the (APP) must be registered first.

Parameters:
group - the group id of the big step rule, see the description of the AbstractProofRule.getGroup() method for details.
name - the name of the rule.
applyMethodName - the name of the apply method.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either name or applyMethodName is null.
See Also:
register(int, String, Method)

registerByMethodName

protected void registerByMethodName(int group,
                                    String name,
                                    String applyMethodName,
                                    String updateMethodName)
Convenience wrapper for the register(int, String, Method, Method) method, which determines the Methods for the specified applyMethodName and updateMethodName and uses them for the Method parameters.

Parameters:
group - the group id of the big step rule, see the description of the AbstractProofRule.getGroup() method for details.
name - the name of the rule.
applyMethodName - the name of the apply method.
updateMethodName - the name of the update method.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either name, applyMethodName or updateMethodName is null.
See Also:
register(int, String, Method, Method)

unregister

protected void unregister(String name)
Convenience wrapper for the AbstractProofRuleSet.unregister(AbstractProofRule) method, which takes a rule name rather than an AbstractProofRule object. The rule must have been previously registered.

Parameters:
name - the name of the rule to unregister.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if no rule of the given name was registered previously.
NullPointerException - if name is null.
See Also:
register(int, String, Method, Method), AbstractProofRuleSet.unregister(AbstractProofRule)
